abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            while sustainability is rated highly likely. World Bank
            performance is evaluated as satisfactory due to the high
            quality and innovative nature of its lending activities and
            its persistent, yet flexible and supportive role in project
            supervision. Overall government performance is considered
            satisfactory. The following lessons can be learned: The key
            to the project's success or failure is the continuity
            and quality of key personnel on the Borrower's as well
            as on the Association's end: with the right people in
            place, complex urban projects, albeit more time-consuming in
            their preparation and their supervision, can be implemented
            successfully. Turnkey contracts can be a desirable vehicle
            for implementing large water supply or wastewater projects.
            Although the two-stage bidding process may be more
            time-consuming, it normally results in superior technical
            designs and a high quality output. During preparation, it is
            important not only to review the organizational set-up of
            project management, but also to ensure that there is an
            explicit commitment by the authorities to provide adequate
            funding for these units. Cultural preservation of historic
            buildings, if properly integrated with urban development,
            can raise ownership pride and commitment by the implementing
            agencies, and appreciation and support by the citizens. In
            those projects requiring a high degree of technical
            assistance, the selection of good consultants can make or
            break a project.
